name: NetworkingRxMinute-ForBusinessProfessionals
0:
”Alexa, what's my Flash Briefing?”
”Alexa, play my Flash Briefing”
skdetail:
Flash Briefing Skill
This skill contains: dynamic content.
des:
The Networking Rx Minute delivers thought-provoking daily insights, inspiration, and advice to help you become the best version of yourself relative to professional life, business networking, and career relationships.

This flash briefing is a hosted by Frank Agin (http://frankagin.com), the founder and president of AmSpirit Business Connections (https://www.amspirit.com). This skill extends the work of empowering entrepreneurs, sales representatives and professionals around the country to become more successful through networking. As a sought-after speaker and consultant to companies and organizations on topics related to professional networking and business relationship development, Frank and AmSpirit help executives and managers to be more effective and efficient, increasing brand awareness through business relationships.

Frank has written numerous articles on professional networking and is the author of several books, including, Foundational Networking: Building Know, Like and Trust to Create a Lifetime of Extraordinary Success, The Champion: Finding the Most Valuable Person In Your Network, and Chase Greatness: Life Lessons Revealed Through Sports. He is also the host of the Networking Rx podcast (http://networkingrx.com/), which provides insights and advice for becoming more successful through networking, as well as interviews with authors, small business icons and thought-leaders.

Frank grew up in Michigan’s Upper Peninsula and now lives with his wife and their children near Columbus, Ohio. He has a law degree and MBA from The Ohio State University and a BA from Beloit College. As community involvement, he is active with The Charitable Roundtable (www.charitableroundtable.com) an organization that helps small non-profits and social initiatives become more successful through networking.
priv: The developer reported that this skill does not collect personal information.
